005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.util.ModuleUtils;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * A base class for name members of a containing model.
015 *
016 * @param <PARENT>
017 *          the Java type of the parent model container for this instance
018 * @param <PARENT_DEFINITION>
019 *          the Java type of the containing assembly definition
020 */
021public abstract class AbstractNamedModelInstance<
022    PARENT extends IContainerModel,
023    PARENT_DEFINITION extends IAssemblyDefinition>
024    extends AbstractNamedInstance<PARENT>
025    implements INamedModelInstance {
026
027  /**
028   * Construct a new instance.
029   *
030   * @param parent
031   *          the parent containing the instance
032   */
033  protected AbstractNamedModelInstance(@NonNull PARENT parent) {
034    super(parent, name -> ModuleUtils.parseModelName(parent.getOwningDefinition().getContainingModule(), name));
035  }
036
037  @Override
038  public final PARENT_DEFINITION getContainingDefinition() {
039    // TODO: look for ways to avoid this cast. The problem is that IContainerModel
040    // is not easily generalized, since this interface is extended by core model
041    // interfaces. Perhaps moving default implementation into abstract or concrete
042    // implementation is a possible path?
043    return ObjectUtils.asType(getParentContainer().getOwningDefinition());
044  }
045
046  @Override
047  public IModule getContainingModule() {
048    return getContainingDefinition().getContainingModule();
049  }
050}
